sentences.english: There were two or three suspicious characters hanging about the fairground.
sentences.chinese: 有两三个可疑分子在集市上闲逛。

sentences.english: He turns and scolds a group of local fighters lounging at a nearby roadblock.
sentences.chinese: 他转过身，骂了在附近的路障闲逛当地战士组。

sentences.english: Dean and Beth continue their exploration of Tihua Street.
sentences.chinese: 迪安与贝丝继续在蒂华街闲逛。

sentences.english: And it's a really nice place just to wander around as well.
sentences.chinese: 那也是一个闲逛的好地方。

sentences.english: I spent the afternoon pottering about in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 我在花园里闲逛消磨下午。

sentences.english: I really enjoy my escapades by wandering around in mountains.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢在山里闲逛带来的冒险。

sentences.english: For everyone who has dreamt of walking the streets of Diagon Alley, they soon will have the chance.
sentences.chinese: 对于梦想在对角巷闲逛的人来说，机会就要来了。

sentences.english: We strolled through the old town and watched a very old house being demolished.
sentences.chinese: 我们在老城闲逛，看到了被拆毁的一座很古老的房子。

sentences.english: but I've definitely been around there a lot.
sentences.chinese: 但我绝对是经常在那周围闲逛的。

sentences.english: Where were they; dawdling in the duty-free at Bangkok airport?
sentences.chinese: 丢在哪里了呢，要不它们在泰国机场免税店里闲逛吧？

sentences.english: So you see a lot of students hanging out in the middle of the park.
sentences.chinese: 所以，你可以看到很多学生在公园里闲逛。

sentences.english: He just lounged around and did nothing.
sentences.chinese: 他四处闲逛，什么事情也不做。

sentences.english: Not to loiter downtown in ice cream stores.
sentences.chinese: 不准在闹市区的冰激凌店闲逛。

sentences.english: As I was very close to the Louvre , I would loiter in the palace the whole morning.
sentences.chinese: 因为离罗浮宫很近，我就整个上午在那宫殿里面闲逛。

sentences.english: She loitered along the street, looking into all the show windows.
sentences.chinese: 她沿街闲逛，看所有的橱窗摆设。

definition: to go sightseeing/to spend one's leisure time wandering around
to stroll/to go for a walk
to roll/to wander around/to appear repeatedly
to roam around/to have a stroll
to swing/to sway/to wobble/to hang around/to hover around
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
at leisure/idle/to have nothing to do
to take a walk/to window-shop/to stroll down the street
